title: Measuring Sea Level Rise From Space
description:
A new satellite, scheduled to launch this weekend, is the latest in a parade of missions to measure sea level rise. As climate reporter Rebecca Hersher explains, it's vital data for scientists trying to understand how global warming is affecting the Earth's oceans.

For more, you can also read Rebecca's story, "NASA Satellite To Measure Global Sea Level Rise."

Email the show at shortwave@npr.org.
copyright: Copyright 2019-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: Measuring Sea Level Rise From Space
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Space is the best place to get a complete picture of how climate change is affecting the Earth's oceans. And what happens in the ocean does not stay in the ocean.
itunes:subtitle: Space is the best place to get a complete picture of how climate change is affecting the Earth's oceans. And what happens in the ocean does not stay in the ocean.
